intro: Ruschia luckhoffii, commonly known as the Cape rose or red-leaf Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that range from pink to red. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its adaptability and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions.
